Key Match Events: Stokes clubbed his replacement for four and six off successive balls to reduce the requirement to 28 from 24 balls
Stokes nicked off Iftikhar Ahmed after finding some extra bounce
Jordan had Shadab Khan caught at mid-off
Stokes would have been run out with 51 needed after slipping but the shy at the stumps was wayward
Post-Match Reflections: England rallied to overpower New Zealand, edge past Sri Lanka and decimate India before seeing off Pakistan to end their opponents’ hopes of winning the T20 World Cup for a second time and of repeating their victory over England at the MCG in the 1992 50-over final.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Alex Hales (1) and Buttler (26 off 17) - so destructive in the 10-wicket demolition of India in Thursday’s semi-final - and Phil Salt (10 off 9) were dismissed
The left-armer striking in his first over for the eighth time in T20 internationals - and Haris Rauf then dismissed Salt and Buttler.
England will remain in Australia to play a three-match one-day international series against Australia, beginning on Thursday at Adelaide before fixtures at the SCG on Saturday and MCG on November 22.
Others: Pakistan were restricted to 137-8 after being inserted
Adil Rashid caught Pakistan captain Babar Azam off his own bowling as England bagged a crucial wicket at the MCG
Stokes and Jordan eased them a touch with a fourth-wicket stand of 39 from 42 balls
